ygData.subject: Open Question Re: General Statement of Substrate/Hypercube Definition
ygData.msgSnippet: Jason, Thank you for responding to my question. In the case that you cite, the intermediate layers that you make reference to, I would refer to as pseudo

Jason,

   Thank you for responding to my question. In the case that you 
c=
ite, the intermediate layers that you make reference to, I would 
refer to =
as "pseudo" hidden nodes, and not "true" hidden nodes. The 
reason for this=
 is: a) the multi-step process could be divided into 
separate sub-tasks in=
 which the individual pairs of layers would be 
input and output layers wit=
h identical dimensionality to the 
input/output layers of the entire multi-=
step process, and b) each of 
the layers maintain a rational basis of dimen=
sionality and are not 
true internal abstractions, remembering that 1d, 2d,=
 & 3d coordinates 
being a subset of the total design space dimensionality.=


   I am not implying that there is anything wrong with using pseudo 
hidd=
en nodes. As a matter of fact, when the problem lends itself to 
their usag=
e, it side-steps the issue that I am attempting to address 
in my question.=


   These type of hidden nodes are an a priori fabrication of the 
substra=
te. I am attempting a more general statement that does not 
stop at 3d spac=
e and can handle the more general case of "true" 
hidden nodes in the subst=
rate, which do not maintain the rational 
basis of dimensionality as cited =
in your example, or fabricated 
duplicates added for the purpose of effecti=
vely capturing input-to-
input or output-to-input connections, due to the c=
urrent limitation 
that 1) nodes only have one unique input (i.e. the summa=
tion of 
multiple inputs counts as only one unique input), and 2) an input =
has 
no activation function.

   Could you please cite an example which use=
s a true hidden node in 
the substrate, and how you would address the incon=
sistencies of the 
inputs for the corresponding hypercube network?

Thanks,=

   Andy Carl
